content:
• Wednesday, February 15, 2012
  • ITRI

    In tandem with its strong Q4 report, Itron (NASDAQ:ITRI) is announcing the acquisition of...

    In tandem with its strong Q4 report, Itron (NASDAQ:ITRI) is announcing the acquisition of SmartSynch, a maker of cellular-enabled networking gear for smart grids. SmartSynch's products complement Itron's smart metering solutions for utilities. Itron forecasts SmartSynch will add $50M to its 2012 revenue, but dilute EPS by $0.10. However, the company promises the acquisition will be accretive by 2013. ITRI +7.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:13 PM
  • ACOM

    More on Ancestry.com's Q4: Subscribers reached 1.703M, up just 2K from Q3. In addition,...

    More on Ancestry.com's Q4: Subscribers reached 1.703M, up just 2K from Q3. In addition, Ancestry's guidance for Q1 revenue of $106M-$108M is below a $108.8M consensus, though 2012 guidance of $455M-$470M is in-line with a $464.3M consensus (investors might be skeptical). 1.825M-1.835M subs are expected at the end of Q1, and 1.915M-1.95M at the end of 2012. ACOM -5.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:28 PM
  • OKE

    ONEOK (NYSE:OKE) rises 0.7% AH after announcing a 2-for-1 stock split, effective June 1. The...

    ONEOK (NYSE:OKE) rises 0.7% AH after announcing a 2-for-1 stock split, effective June 1. The natural gas firm's shares closed today at $80.45.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • CAR

    More on Avis Budget Group (NASDAQ:CAR): Q4 misses on all fronts due to acquisition-related...

    More on Avis Budget Group (NASDAQ:CAR): Q4 misses on all fronts due to acquisition-related charges stemming from its purchase of Avis Europe in October, 2011. Revenue actually increased 33% Y/Y on a jump in day rental volume plus a reduction in pricing. Shares -3.2% AH.

  • LOGM

    More on LogMeIn's Q4: The company expects Q1 revenue of $32M-$32.3M and EPS of $0.12-$0.13...

    More on LogMeIn's Q4: The company expects Q1 revenue of $32M-$32.3M and EPS of $0.12-$0.13 (consensus of $31.9M and $0.17), and 2012 revenue of $140M-$142M and EPS of $0.60-$0.65 (consensus of $141.4M and $0.79). Though guidance might appear unimpressive, the fact LogMeIn's top-line forecasts remain healthy in spite of a recent business model shift seems to be going over well. LOGM +7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • NILE

    More on Blue Nile's Q4: Earnings miss blamed on weak demand from high-end and international...

    More on Blue Nile's Q4: Earnings miss blamed on weak demand from high-end and international customers, and higher diamond costs. Company expects Q1 revenue of $81M-$84M and EPS of $0.04-$0.07 (consensus of $88.3M and $0.17). It expects 2012 revenue of $384M-$417M and EPS of $0.70-$0.85 (consensus of $388M and $1.09). A $100M stock buyback has been authorized. NILE -24.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM

    Skechers U.(NYSE:SKX): Q4 EPS of -$1.18 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.22. Revenue of $283.2M (-37.6% Y/Y) misses by $41M. Shares -1.9% AH. (PR)

  • AMD

    More on Nvidia's FQ4: Gross margin is expected to fall to 48.5%-50.5% in FQ1, from 52.5% in FQ4....

    More on Nvidia's FQ4: Gross margin is expected to fall to 48.5%-50.5% in FQ1, from 52.5% in FQ4. In prepared comments (.pdf), Nvidia notes PC graphics chip sales fell 3.6% Q/Q, though that's better than AMD's 5% decline in Q4. More troubling is a 42.5% Q/Q drop in Consumer Products sales, evidence of the challenges Nvidia's Tegra processors face in the smartphone and tablet markets. NVDA -4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • ET

    Energy Transfer Partners (ETP): Q4 EPS of $0.41 misses by $0.31. Revenue of $1.82B (+25.1% Y/Y)...

    Energy Transfer Partners (ETP): Q4 EPS of $0.41 misses by $0.31. Revenue of $1.82B (+25.1% Y/Y) misses by $290M. Shares -1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • CBS

    More on CBS' Q4: Like Disney, CBS' results were hurt by weakness in its broadcasting division -...

    More on CBS' Q4: Like Disney, CBS' results were hurt by weakness in its broadcasting division - sales fell 12% Y/Y, worse than Q3's 3% drop. Cable Networks sales rose 7%, thanks to higher rates and subscriptions for Showtime and CBS Sports. The Entertainment (CBS shows and films) and Publishing divisions saw their sales fall 1%. $170M worth of shares were repurchased. CBS -2.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • Z

    More on Zillow (NASDAQ:Z): Q4 Marketplace revenue +169% Y/Y to $13.7M. Display revenue +38% to...

    More on Zillow (NASDAQ:Z): Q4 Marketplace revenue +169% Y/Y to $13.7M. Display revenue +38% to $6.1M. Monthly unique users +86% to 23.5M. Mobile users in focus: Nearly 100M homes - 36/second - viewed on Zillow Mobile in December. 2012 Q1 revenue forecast $20.5-$21.5M, +87% Y/Y. Adjusted EBITDA expected at $3-$3.5M, +200% Y/Y. Shares +2.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM

  • SCG

    Scana (SCG -0.9%) closes in the red after missing Q4 estimates on both EPS and revenue. Profit...

    Scana (SCG -0.9%) closes in the red after missing Q4 estimates on both EPS and revenue. Profit dipped 9.6% Y/Y as the electric and gas utility struggles with uneven residential demand and weakness in its retail gas unit.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • DPS-OLD

    Dr Pepper Snapple Group (DPS-OLD +2%) finishes higher after beating Q4 estimates earlier. Profit...

    Dr Pepper Snapple Group (DPS-OLD +2%) finishes higher after beating Q4 estimates earlier. Profit rose a better-than-expected 48% as higher prices helped to stem the impact of rising packaging and ingredient costs and lower sales volume.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • NTAP

    NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP): FQ3 EPS of $0.58 in-line. Revenue of $1.566B (+21% Y/Y) beats by $6M....

    NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP): FQ3 EPS of $0.58 in-line. Revenue of $1.566B (+21% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Company expects FQ4 revenue of $1.645B-$1.725B vs. $1.68B consensus. Expects EPS of $0.60-$0.65 vs. $0.63 consensus. Shares +8.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • CHTR

    Who needs Time Warner Cable (TWC)? Madison Square Garden (MSG -0.5%) says Lin-sanity powered...

    Who needs Time Warner Cable (TWC)? Madison Square Garden (MSG -0.5%) says Lin-sanity powered last night's New York Knicks basketball game to the network's highest ratings since Carmelo Anthony's debut on Feb. 23 of last season. But shares tumble near the close, apparently the victim of a bit of old-fashioned profit-taking after a 9% rise since Feb. 3.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • OC

    Owens Corning (OC -6.6%) takes a hit after swinging and missing on its Q4 report this morning....

    Owens Corning (OC -6.6%) takes a hit after swinging and missing on its Q4 report this morning. Earnings were relatively flat Y/Y due to a slump in composite sales, and despite signs of growth in its building materials and a recovery in the housing market.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • FOSL

    Fossil (FOSL -2.4%) falters under the weight of three analyst downgrades a day after the seller...

    Fossil (FOSL -2.4%) falters under the weight of three analyst downgrades a day after the seller of consumer fashion accessories reported a mixed bag of Q4 results. Benchmark, lowering shares to Hold, sees Skagen and the Michael Kors jewelry line as solid growth vehicles but believes they're already baked into expectations; BofA and Credit Agricole also cut their ratings.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • LHO

    Baird cut the hotel sector to Market Weight based on full valuations earlier today: LaSalle...

    Baird cut the hotel sector to Market Weight based on full valuations earlier today: LaSalle Hotel (LHO -2.2%), Host Hotels (HST -1.4%) and Pebblebrook Hotel (PEB -2.7%) are all downgraded to Neutral (I, II, III).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • GCO

    Sterne Agee lifts its price target on Genesco (GCO +5.2%), as the firm says it has learned from...

    Sterne Agee lifts its price target on Genesco (GCO +5.2%), as the firm says it has learned from industry sources that the seller of hats and footwear will begin shuttering its Underground Station street fashion concept, which has been a drag on profitability.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • ON

    Fairchild Semiconductor (FCS +2.9%) moves up on positive comments out of FBR Capital. The firm...

    Fairchild Semiconductor (FCS +2.9%) moves up on positive comments out of FBR Capital. The firm says channel checks indicate business is starting to rebound solidly following the Chinese New Year and global inventory de-stocking. It raises its price target for the shares to $18 from $16.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • KMB

    Kimberly Clark (KMB -0.7%) dips after Janney Capital downgraded the shares to Neutral earlier...

    Kimberly Clark (KMB -0.7%) dips after Janney Capital downgraded the shares to Neutral earlier today, citing less margin visibility, a reduced mix benefit and a risk/reward scenario that's currently balanced.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • NCMI

    National CineMedia (NCMI +6.6%) moves higher after Piper Jaffray ups the shares to Overweight on...

    National CineMedia (NCMI +6.6%) moves higher after Piper Jaffray ups the shares to Overweight on valuation, citing expectations for an improving ad market and attendance.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG) announces a deal with Facebook that clarifies the use of its Facetones mark and...

    Vringo (VRNG) announces a deal with Facebook that clarifies the use of its Facetones mark and domain name and limits its scope. The agreement ends a potential legal dispute over the issue between the firms. Shares of VRNG are currently halted after soaring 11.9% after the news broke.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • ARB

    Arbitron (ARB -6.7%) shares are cut to Hold from Buy with a reduced price target of $38 from $46...

    Arbitron (ARB -6.7%) shares are cut to Hold from Buy with a reduced price target of $38 from $46 at Deutsche Bank following weak guidance and possible deceleration in the core business beyond 2012 when the PPM price uplift has run its course. While new initiatives are in development, DB sees ARB's EPS growing only in the low teens through 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • ALNY

    Off sharply on Tuesday after filing to sell 7M shares, Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY +14.7%) is...

    Off sharply on Tuesday after filing to sell 7M shares, Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY +14.7%) is more than recouping its losses after pricing its offering (increased to 7.5M shares) at $10.75. A high short interest (11.2% of float shorted as of Jan. 31) could be contributing to recent volatility.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • CW

    Shares of Curtiss-Wright (CW -8.4%) fade on heavy volume after etching out a 52-week high...

    Shares of Curtiss-Wright (CW -8.4%) fade on heavy volume after etching out a 52-week high yesterday in advance of its in-line Q4 earnings report. Deutsche Bank added to the selling pressure with a downgrade to Hold on a valuation call.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -2.9%), which soared following its FQ1 beat, is seeing some...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -2.9%), which soared following its FQ1 beat, is seeing some profit-taking following the anticipated introduction of its Keurig Vue brewer line. The Keurig Vue, which Green Mountain is hoping will help lower the impact of upcoming K-Cup patent expirations, boasts more customization options than traditional Keurig brewers, and supports larger portion sizes.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • HAS

    Hasbro (HAS -2.4%) dips after Stifel Nicolaus cut the shares to Neutral, citing earnings...

    Hasbro (HAS -2.4%) dips after Stifel Nicolaus cut the shares to Neutral, citing earnings pressure as retailers work off excess inventories and game unit challenges.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • SHIP

    Seanergy Maritime (SHIP +21.5%) shares surge on volume 20x greater than normal after the dry...

    Seanergy Maritime (SHIP +21.5%) shares surge on volume 20x greater than normal after the dry bulk shipper reported an unexpected profit in Q4, helped by increased operating days and reduced costs. However, market conditions are expected to remain weak in 2012 as new vessel deliveries add to oversupply in the industry, depressing rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate (LGF +7.1%) is making new highs thanks to bullish comments from Jim Cramer, who...

    Lions Gate (LGF +7.1%) is making new highs thanks to bullish comments from Jim Cramer, who expects shares to continue moving higher ahead of the March 23 release of The Hunger Games. Cramer notes the huge following that exists for Suzanne Collins' book series, and uses back-of-the-envelope math to suggest the franchise's films could be worth $400M to Lions Gate.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • CSOD

    Cornerstone OnDemand (NASDAQ:CSOD) currently up 2.2% and has traded as much as 6% higher so far...

    Cornerstone OnDemand (NASDAQ:CSOD) currently up 2.2% and has traded as much as 6% higher so far today after reporting results where it beat revenue expectations ($22.39M vs. expected $21.65M). Q4 EPS was -$0.06 vs. -$0.03. The company ended 2011 with more than 800 clients and about 7.5M users, and full-year gross revenue of $75.5M, up 62% from 2010.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • AVGO

    Avago (AVGO +1.9%) moves up on positive comments out of Citigroup this morning, saying the...

    Avago (AVGO +1.9%) moves up on positive comments out of Citigroup this morning, saying the company can earn an EPS of $4.00 or more in 2014 and continues to view the stock as a core holding. The firm recommends buying the shares on any pullback.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • ACPW

    Active Power (ACPW -13%) takes a hit after missing Q4 estimates yesterday. Stifel Nicolaus...

    Active Power (ACPW -13%) takes a hit after missing Q4 estimates yesterday. Stifel Nicolaus downgrades the shares to Hold on the report, citing problems with the company's UPS business, difficulties with the company's internal strategy and margin deterioration.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -2.8%) slumps after a new court filing (.pdf) related to its patent...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -2.8%) slumps after a new court filing (.pdf) related to its patent infringement/antitrust battle with Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) states Microsoft's attempts to obtain royalties on Android-based Nooks don't qualify as patent misuse, even if the attempts are carried out with the goal of "eliminating Android as a competitor." 2 weeks ago, the ITC granted a motion to dismiss B&N's antitrust claims against Microsoft.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • AAPL

    Perhaps having something to do with the move in Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) is chatter the Nasdaq could...

    Perhaps having something to do with the move in Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) is chatter the Nasdaq could be rebalanced to cut the stock's influence. When this occurred in April 2011, Apple sold off (before taking flight again). There's also word Amazon China has pulled the iPad2 from sale due to the Proview trademark suit.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 13 Comments
  • NPTN

    NeoPhotonics (NPTN -5.4%) slumps after reporting Q4 revenue of $47.2M (+14% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    NeoPhotonics (NPTN -5.4%) slumps after reporting Q4 revenue of $47.2M (+14% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.26. Though the latter beat by $0.10, investors are focused on the optical component maker's guidance for Q1 EPS of -$0.25 to -$0.35 (consensus of -$0.27). With NeoPhotonics providing solid Q1 revenue guidance ($46M-$51M vs. $47.7M), the EPS guidance suggests the margin pressures the company saw in 2011 aren't abating.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • ASIA

    AsiaInfo-Linkage (ASIA -2.8%) dips after being cut to sell by UBS on the back of its Q4 miss and...

    AsiaInfo-Linkage (ASIA -2.8%) dips after being cut to sell by UBS on the back of its Q4 miss and challenging outlook.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • K

    More love for Kellogg (K +5.3%) (previous): UBS restaurant sector analyst David Palmer approves...

    More love for Kellogg (K +5.3%) (previous): UBS restaurant sector analyst David Palmer approves of the deal (video) to snap up the Pringles brand - noting that the company is now bigger in an area that's "clearly expanding" both overseas and stateside. He also sees Kellogg as more competitive with PepsiCo (PEP -0.6%) in the snack foods market.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • SEEL

    Shares of Apricus Biosciences (APRI +4.4%) kick up a gain after the firm announces that its...

    Shares of Apricus Biosciences (APRI +4.4%) kick up a gain after the firm announces that its NexMed subsidiary has signed a collaboration agreement with a division of Novartis (NVS +0.1%) to market Vitarose in Germany.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • AAPL

    There's panic in the pits as the bottom drops out of Apple (AAPL -0.2%), the stock giving up a...

    There's panic in the pits as the bottom drops out of Apple (AAPL -0.2%), the stock giving up a 3% session gain and now showing a rare red print. Not surprisingly, it has pulled the major indices down to session lows. DJIA -0.5%, Nasdaq +0.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM | 23 Comments
  • HMA

    Health Management (HMA +1.3%) moves up on positive comments out of Susquehanna following the...

    Health Management (HMA +1.3%) moves up on positive comments out of Susquehanna following the company's conference call this morning. The firm says it's comfortable with the health care operator's ability to achieve 2012 guidance, noting that it continues to post impressive top and bottom line growth rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • WCG

    WellCare Health Plans (WCG +10.9%) jumps after blowing out its Q4 earnings this morning. Net...

    WellCare Health Plans (WCG +10.9%) jumps after blowing out its Q4 earnings this morning. Net profit tripled, helped by a gain from repurchasing notes, as the managed-care services provider's membership and premium revenue continues to grow. The company's also gave an upbeat FY12 forecast, now expecting to earn around $4.40 - $ 4.60 per share, above the Street consensus of $4.21.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • MTP

    DARA Biosciences (DARA +8.5%) pops after signing an exclusive agreement with Uman Pharma for...

    DARA Biosciences (DARA +8.5%) pops after signing an exclusive agreement with Uman Pharma for U.S. commercialization rights to its newly licensed anticancer-agent gemcitabine.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • K

    Kellogg (K +5.2%) shares power higher after scooping up Pringles from Procter & Gamble...

    Kellogg (K +5.2%) shares power higher after scooping up Pringles from Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG) and analysts line up to approve the deal. Deutsche Bank applauds Kellogg for expanding away from cereal, estimating snacks will now represent 46% of total sales vs. 40% previously: "This is important as almost all cultures embrace snacks while few globally embrace cereal."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • MSG

    Madison Square Garden (MSG +1.1%) jumps higher again as Linsanity hits new heights with a...

    Madison Square Garden (MSG +1.1%) jumps higher again as Linsanity hits new heights with a buzzer-beating winning shot from the NBA's ultimate rags-to-riches story. Arquitos Capital Management's Steven Kiel notes that the success of the Knicks not only adds to MSG's top-line result - it also pressures Time Warner Cable (TWC +2.1%) to settle a deal with MSG on more favorable terms to keep Knicks fans from jumping ship.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • EGY

    Vaalco Energy (EGY +23%) surges to a 52-week high after announcing it had received written...

    Vaalco Energy (EGY +23%) surges to a 52-week high after announcing it had received written confirmation from Angola's national oil company Sonangol that the government granted a time extension of the production sharing agreement for Block 5 through the end of 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • JNPR

    Juniper (JNPR +10.1%), recently pressured by a Q4 warning and weak Q1 guidance, skyrockets after...

    Juniper (JNPR +10.1%), recently pressured by a Q4 warning and weak Q1 guidance, skyrockets after Jefferies says its talks with telecom industry contacts suggest equipment sales to major U.S. carriers "will shortly see a major acceleration," in spite of the downbeat commentary (I, II, III) of many firms. Also getting a boost from the report: APKT +2.1%. TLAB +2.9%. JDSU +3.6%. (previously)
